text:
Happy Birthday to the United States Air Force! 🇺🇸✈️

As someone proud to still serve in the Air National Guard, I’m deeply honored to celebrate 78 years of excellence, integrity, and service before self. Here's to the men and women who keep our skies safe! https://t.co/2bpVjRgNC4

The Constitution is a promise that power belongs to the People, and that our rights come from God, not government.

Nearly 250 years later, we still bear the responsibility to defend it. https://t.co/uaFrDyHWBX

Last night, I had the solemn honor of attending a prayer vigil in the U.S. Capitol for Charlie Kirk. It was deeply moving to see leaders from across the country united in prayer for a man who devoted his life to truth, faith, and peaceful discourse.

At the same time, a powerful vigil was held back home in Anderson; where lives were changed, hearts were healed, and many came to know Christ.

It’s clear Charlie’s legacy lives on. He spoke boldly for biblical values and touched countless lives, even in his final moments.

This morning, I was honored to join my fellow South Carolina delegation members at the annual South Carolina Prayer Breakfast.

In times like these, when our nation is hurting and hearts are heavy, gathering in prayer is more important than ever.

Yesterday, I spoke with @NewsNation about the tragic assassination of Charlie Kirk.

This is a heartbreaking loss, but also a turning point for our country.

Charlie’s voice is louder than ever, and his legacy of peaceful, patriotic discourse will not be silenced. 🇺🇸 https://t.co/M6uE9RfPs8

This week, I spoke with President Clements to express my deep concern over the ignorant, hateful comments made by several Clemson University personnel, related to the assassination of Charlie Kirk on a college campus. These individuals responsible for such reprehensible comments, who have been entrusted with the great responsibility of educating our college youth, clearly violated that duty and should be fired immediately.

Charlie Kirk was a man of faith who lived boldly for Christ and inspired a generation of young people to stand for truth through their voices, not violence. We continue to pray for his wife and family as they grieve their heartbreaking loss - a true loss for our entire nation.

I am grateful for the swift action of the local, state, and federal law enforcement agencies who made this investigation a top priority, and for the steady leadership of President Trump and Vice President Vance during this time.

To honor Charlie’s legacy, I joined Rep. Chip Roy’s letter calling for a Select Committee to investigate the radical left’s campaign of political violence that threatens our freedoms and our way of life.
We will never forget. 🇺🇸 https://t.co/vtNJFYKGZQ
Please say a prayer for Charlie Kirk right now. May the Lord protect him and provide his wife and family with comfort at this time. 🙏

Stopped by the National Mall to visit some of our incredible South Carolina National Guard members who’ve been sent to D.C. to help stop the rise in violent crime. These men and women are stepping up to protect our nation’s capital, and I couldn’t be more proud.

Seeing their commitment in uniform reminds me exactly why I continue to serve in the Air National Guard.  When America calls, South Carolina's Third District answers. 🇺🇸

A sweet surprise from House Republican Leadership to celebrate the passage of my first bill in Congress! 🎉🍪

Grateful for the support from constituents and for my hard working staff who helped lead in getting the Made-in-America Defense Act across the finish line. It’s an honor to deliver results for South Carolina’s Third District!

I went to the House floor and made it clear: it’s time to put American workers and manufacturers first.

My bill, the Made-in-America Defense Act, passed, and I’m proud to deliver for South Carolina’s Third District. 🇺🇸 https://t.co/BByDq1nhb3

BREAKING: The Made-in-America Defense Act just PASSED the House! ✅🇺🇸 

This is a huge step forward for American workers, small businesses, and our national security. 

I came to Congress to deliver results for South Carolina’s Third District, and today, we did just that. https://t.co/1iBHVTZbyp

🎧 Full podcast episode here: https://t.co/wukQJVMFT8

The Made-in-America Defense Act is a win for national security and our small businesses. Let’s get it passed!

Exciting news: The Made-in-America Defense Act is going to the House floor TODAY! 🇺🇸

This bill is all about creating jobs and giving American manufacturers the chance to lead. I’m proud to deliver for the workers and small businesses of South Carolina’s Third District! https://t.co/iPSIdLRCwk

The best Saturdays are college football Saturdays - cheering on our Clemson Tigers! Unfortunately yesterday, we came up just a bit short of the Tigers of LSU.

It was great seeing so many friends and constituents in Death Valley, including @RepTimmons (SC-04) and @SenatorTimScott! 

Go Tigers! 🐅

Visited AT&T’s Central Office to learn how FirstNet is helping our first responders stay connected when it matters most.

Proud to support tools that strengthen our first responders' lifesaving work across South Carolina. https://t.co/6hvploQs7b

I had the great honor of meeting Mr. Robert Floyd, a 103-year-old World War II veteran and proud South Carolinian. 🇺🇸  

I was humbled to present him with a flag and thank him for his incredible service to our nation. His courage and patriotism continue to inspire us all.  

If you know a veteran, first responder, or community hero who deserves to be recognized, please reach out to me or my office - I’d love to hear their story.

It was a joy to visit Morningside of Anderson and spend time with the incredible residents and dedicated staff at this wonderful assisted living community.

With over 30 years in health care, from ICU nurse to nursing home administrator, caring for others has always been close to my heart. 💙

Today we remember the 13 brave U.S. service members lost at Abbey Gate in Kabul.

As someone who served in Afghanistan, this tragedy is personal. It was preventable, and we owe it to them to never forget. https://t.co/dCCLJcKiP6

It was a pleasure visiting Newberry County Memorial Hospital and seeing the incredible work their staff is doing for our community.

As a nurse practitioner, I know how hard it can be for rural hospitals to keep their doors open. That’s why I voted for the Rural Health Transformation Program to help small hospitals stay open and keep serving the communities that rely on them. 💙🏥

After 80 years, Tech. Sgt. Clarence E. Gibbs is finally home. 🇺🇸

Killed in action during WWII, he was missing in action until his remains were identified earlier this year. It was an honor to speak at his funeral in Clinton and present a flag to his family on behalf of a grateful nation.

Welcome home, hero.

Proud to see our military strong and growing again. 

Army recruiting is up 10%!

Read the op-ed I co-wrote with Rep. Anna Paulina Luna via Fox News: https://t.co/7KUVmnEQzv

Welcome home, heroes! 

It was an honor to join families in Easley to welcome home the brave men and women of the 263rd AAMDC & 263rd ADA Battalion after 10 months of deployment in Syria and Iraq.

We are so proud of their service and sacrifice, and so grateful to have them back on South Carolina soil.

Proud to partner with @RepLuna on this important piece. Under President Trump and Secretary Hegseth, the military is regaining its warrior ethos, and women are stepping up to serve in record numbers.

Read our op-ed via @FoxNews: https://t.co/7KUVmnFop3 https://t.co/W4SpnGxzDt

We mourn the passing of Dr. James Dobson, a faithful servant of God and tireless advocate for families.

His legacy of strengthening faith, defending life, and standing for Biblical values will endure for generations. My prayers are with Shirley and the entire Dobson family. https://t.co/7NQaAuIZlv

It was an honor to visit Upstate Warrior Solution and UVAN; two outstanding organizations serving veterans here in the Third District. 

As a current servicemember, I was proud to place a pin on their map showing where I’ve served. 

If you or someone you know needs help with the VA, my office is here to assist. 🇺🇸

South Carolina’s energy future is strong 💡

I had the opportunity to tour Duke Energy’s Bad Creek Hydroelectric Station, one of the largest pumped hydro facilities in the country, right here in Oconee County. This critical investment supports affordable, reliable energy for families and businesses across the Upstate.

Proud to support long-term infrastructure that powers growth and strengthens our grid for decades to come. 🇺🇸⚡️

It was an honor to join @AGPamBondi, @AGAlanWilson, @RepJoeWilson, @RepTimmons, and @RepRussellFry for a law enforcement summit here in South Carolina. 

From stopping fentanyl and human trafficking to securing the border, we’re carrying out President Trump’s mission to defend law & order and keep America safe.

Great discussion with the Laurens County Water & Sewer Commission about the vital role reliable water infrastructure plays in supporting our communities, families, and economic growth here in the 3rd District. 💧🇺🇸

Had a wonderful meet & greet in Clinton! Its a joy to visit with friends from our community, hear about the town’s proud textile history, and share in the excitement for the future.

I’m grateful for everyone who took the time to stop by. Your hospitality and stories mean so much. 🇺🇸

Recently toured the brand-new YMCA and Child Development Center in Laurens County!

This incredible facility will support hundreds of local families with quality childcare. Grateful for Mr. Brian Harlan and the people making it all happen.

Has your family ever been part of a YMCA program? I’d love to hear about it!

I had the honor of visiting the incredible first responders in Abbeville. Their dedication and service are what keep our communities strong.

I'm meeting with first responders across the Third District to thank them for all they do. Stay tuned: you might see a familiar face next!

Know someone who serves? Tag them below so I can recognize them too!

I too have heard of the tragic shooting at Fort Stewart in Georgia, and my heart is heavy. As a fellow service member, my prayers are with the wounded, their families, and all impacted. May God’s healing hand be upon them, and may He bring peace and protection to those in our military. 🇺🇸🙏

Enjoyed joining the Fountain Inn Rotary to give a legislative update and highlight how we’re fighting for the people of South Carolina’s Third District in Washington. 🇺🇸

If you'd like to stay updated too, I invite you to sign up for my newsletter for the latest on our work, wins, and what’s ahead: https://t.co/3YiREDHBvV

Great to tour Kyocera AVX’s global HQ in Fountain Inn, SC! 🇺🇸

Proud to see cutting-edge tech and world-class manufacturing thriving in the Third District. I am grateful for their role in strengthening America’s defense, innovation, and economy. https://t.co/3fOnnr8Es3

I recently toured the Edgefield Detention Center and met the dedicated men and women who work every day to keep our communities safe.

I’m committed to putting our community first, and that means standing strong for law and order. I fully support our brave officers on the streets and the professionals behind the walls who guard against public safety threats.

I’ll continue to fight for the resources and recognition they deserve. Public safety is not optional - it's essential.

Happy Intern Day! We’re so thankful for all of our amazing interns this year. Pictured here are Maddie and Elizabeth; just two of the bright, dedicated young leaders helping serve the people of SC-03.

Interested in joining our team? Reach out to our office to learn more about internship opportunities! 🇺🇸

Honored to meet the Padgett family and young Malani, the incredible founder of Saving Saluda Strays 🐾

Her heart for rescuing and rehabilitating dogs and cats is truly inspiring. I was proud to present her with a challenge coin in recognition of her compassion, leadership, and service to our community. 💙

South Carolina is blessed with young leaders like Malani who are making a real difference!

Proud to represent South Carolina and serve as the only woman on the National Security Taskforce. Grateful to join Secretary of Defense @PeteHegseth  and fellow members to advance strong, America First policies that keep our nation safe. https://t.co/zBgPO3D9eI

South Carolina peaches made it to DC last week thanks to Titan Farms and our incredible farmers! 🍑

SC-03 leads in peach production; Titan grows more than Georgia and is the largest grower on the East Coast with 6,000+ acres. Grateful for our hardworking farmers who keep America fed!

Today we honor the brave men and women who served in the Korean War, true American heroes who defended freedom on distant shores. Your sacrifice and courage will never be forgotten. 🇺🇸 https://t.co/6T1CBZ8uta

Happy Parents’ Day to the moms and dads who shape the heart of our families and the future of our nation. Your love, sacrifice, and guidance are the foundation of the strong community we have in the Third District. Thank you for all you do!💙 https://t.co/OXqrQaEUKB

I recently joined my House colleagues for a productive meeting with @DrOzCMS to discuss the Trump Administration’s push to put patients first in healthcare.

We’re focused on expanding access, cutting red tape, and delivering better care for hardworking Americans. Proud to support this important effort. 🇺🇸

Proud to stand with President Trump at the White House as we celebrate a the historic wins we’ve delivered so far for the American people. Now, I’m heading home to South Carolina to visit with you, all across the district, during the August work period. Let’s keep up the momentum!

✅ Proud to announce the Made-in-America Defense Act just passed out of committee!

This is a win for American workers, a win for our allies, and a win for South Carolina’s manufacturing base. We’re cutting red tape, speeding up defense deliveries, and creating good-paying jobs right here at home in SC-03.

Let’s keep this momentum going, all the way to the House floor. 🇺🇸💪

📢 Just released: My full statement on the Made-in-America Defense Act passing @HouseForeignGOP committee.

My bill advances President Trump’s vision for faster, more accountable defense sales, while bringing jobs and investment home to South Carolina’s Third District.

Read how we’re strengthening our defense, supporting our allies, and fueling American manufacturing. ⬇️

https://t.co/pmR26Lx7y7

📣 Taxpayer-funded bias in public media ends now. @RepMaryMiller - we delivered a win for everyday Americans by cutting partisan subsidies by passing the rescissions package. Read more 👇👇👇

https://t.co/E8xpHx7D0j

What a night! So proud to take the field and WIN in honor of my dear friend Keri, whose faith and strength continue to inspire me every day. 💗

It meant the world to have Keri’s family there cheering us on. Their presence was a beautiful reminder of the impact one life can have.

Grateful to be part of the Congressional Softball Game and to stand with so many fighting cancer. 

#CWSG

Great news for South Carolina’s Third District! President Trump’s tariffs didn’t just protect American workers, they brought jobs home. 🇺🇸

Over 1,600 jobs in Newberry thanks to strong, commonsense trade policies. Let’s keep putting America first!

Tonight, I’m taking the field in honor of my late friend Keri, whose faith and courage in the face of brain cancer continues to inspire me every day.
 
I’m proud to play in the Congressional Softball Game to help support all those who have been impacted by cancer across the country. 
 
Tune in LIVE on C-SPAN tonight at 7:00 PM ET and cheer us on!

#CongressionalSoftball
#CWSG

Tonight I hosted over 100 faith leaders from all across America for a late night tour of the Capitol. 

We had an inspiring evening sharing stories of faith in America, spending time in prayer, and capped it off with the singing of How Great Thou Art and God Bless America underneath the dome. 

God bless America, indeed! 🇺🇸

California Governor Gavin Newsom is swinging through South Carolina's Third District today hoping to convince South Carolinians that open borders, more government control, coddling criminals, and taking voices away from parents is what's right for America.

Bless his heart.

Gavin, we don't need your California agenda. This is God’s country, and we’re going to keep it that way! 🇺🇸

https://t.co/bgPBvYqn18

Happy Independence Day! Today we celebrate the enduring spirit of freedom and the brave men and women who made it all possible. God bless America, and may we always fight to keep her strong and free. 🇺🇸 https://t.co/mfy5bNUreP

I just voted to deliver the One Big Beautiful Bill to President Trump’s desk. Below is my official statement.

To read more, view my full release here: https://t.co/eO4KvjurKM https://t.co/g9bUTROL3N

This afternoon I joined @NEWSMAX to discuss the Israel / Iran ceasefire - brokered by President Trump, the House's work to pass the One Big Beautiful Bill Act, and remembering June as PTSD Awareness Month. 

Read and watch below!

https://t.co/LSoAyUatay

195 Democrats just REFUSED to condemn the violent LA riots.

Law Enforcement officers were injured. Businesses destroyed. Property damaged. Chaos in the streets.

But the Left couldn’t bring themselves to say it was wrong.

Next time you hear them say “condemn all violence” or “support law enforcement”… don’t buy it.

Actions speak louder than words.

VICTORY for life and South Carolina! 

The Supreme Court has affirmed our right to keep taxpayer dollars from funding abortion providers. I was proud to sign the amicus brief and rally in front of the Court in defense of life. This is a HUGE win for our values and the unborn! https://t.co/mwaPzkBRtI

President Trump called Voice of America (VOA) a “TOTAL, LEFTWING DISASTER...” Today, I questioned Kari Lake, Senior Advisor to the U.S. Agency for Global Media, about this very concern. Watch below! https://t.co/oSx87NAYgd

Had a great visit with students from the SC Governor’s School for Agriculture! Their curiosity, drive, and dedication to South Carolina’s farming future made a lasting impression. The future of agriculture is in good hands! https://t.co/OqeEtzZPQ7

Great to meet with the incredible women of @Women4GunRights today. Their passion, patriotism, and commitment to protecting our constitutional freedoms is inspiring. Proud to stand with them in defense of the Second Amendment! https://t.co/htq4q8sO3R
PEACE THROUGH STRENGTH 🇺🇸

Peace is the only long-term option for Iran. The world knows — and the Iranian regime must remember — that the United States of America is the strongest nation on earth. I am grateful to President Trump for his leadership in this time, and pray God keeps our troops and our country safe.

I joined OAN to talk about why American passports should never be a tool for terrorists and drug traffickers.

If you’re charged with or convicted of helping cartels or foreign terrorist groups, you shouldn’t be allowed to use a U.S. passport to move fentanyl across borders. https://t.co/UUrYJ4E4r4

I thank God that Donald Trump is the President of the United States to keep our Nation safe. I trust his leadership during this critical time. As a combat veteran, I also express deep appreciation for the precision and exceptionalism of our military. As President Trump stated, ‘now is the time for peace.’ May God continue to bless the United States of America. 🇺🇸

Honored to meet with Secretary of Veterans Affairs to discuss how we can better serve the brave men and women who’ve worn the uniform. Supporting our veterans isn’t just a promise — it’s a duty. Proud to stand up for South Carolina’s heroes. https://t.co/BxhK9tKBhx

Over 80% of fentanyl trafficked through U.S. Ports of Entry is smuggled by American citizens — many working with terrorist-backed cartels.

I introduced the No Passports for Terrorists and Traffickers Act to stop these bad actors from using their U.S. passports to keep smuggling drugs across borders.

If you’re charged with or convicted of helping terrorists or traffickers, you shouldn’t be able to use an American passport as a tool to harm Americans.

Proud to vote yes on a slate of strong bills in the @HouseScience markup — especially the ACERO Act, which helps modernize wildfire response, protect our skies, and keep foreign adversaries out of our airspace.

This is how we lead with innovation and security. https://t.co/ayGV0Zobnv

As a proud member of the National Guard, it was an honor to meet with Gen. Steven Nordhaus, Chief of the National Guard Bureau and member of the Joint Chiefs of Staff.

We discussed the vital role our 430,000+ Guardsmen play in protecting our homeland and serving both state and nation. I’m grateful for his leadership and continued commitment to our mission. 🇺🇸

Today we celebrate the American flag — our enduring symbol of liberty, resolve, and the American spirit.

May we always honor the values it stands for. 🇺🇸

#FlagDay https://t.co/w9h97I6iH9

Proud to have met with the State Executive Director for the USDA Farm Service Agency in South Carolina, Cody Simpson (@wrcodysimpson3), to discuss how we can work together to support our farmers, our strengthen rural communities, and ensure agricultural opportunity stays right here at home.

Thanks for all you do for our famers and for the state of South Carolina! 🚜

🎉 Happy 250th Birthday to the U.S. Army!

Thank you to every soldier — past and present — who has stood guard for our freedoms. We’re forever grateful for your courage, sacrifice, and service. 🇺🇸 https://t.co/fz8SvJNAU2

I was asked about the lawlessness in Los Angeles and why sanctuary cities are spiraling out of control.

Here’s what I said 👇

Watch my Newsmax interview on the Mobilizing Against Sanctuary Cities Act — because if cities defy federal law, they shouldn’t get federal funding. https://t.co/99F97dtG1T

America stands with Israel. As Scripture reminds us, God’s covenant with Israel is everlasting. I join President Trump in urging Iran to choose peace over conflict. We stand for Israel’s right to defend herself and live in peace. https://t.co/Y7r0ZxhYgL

Today on Women Veterans Day, I’m proud to stand with the brave women who’ve worn our nation’s uniform — including those who came before me and those still serving. Your strength, sacrifice, and trailblazing spirit have helped shape our military and our nation. Thank you for your service. 🇺🇸

Honored to welcome Mackenzie Evans of Wren High School to the Capitol! 🎨🇺🇸

Her winning piece in this year’s Congressional Art Competition is now proudly displayed in the halls of Congress. It was a joy to meet her in person and celebrate the incredible talent coming out of South Carolina’s Third District!

Congratulations again, Mackenzie!

🚨 I just introduced the Mobilizing Against Sanctuary Cities Act.

If you defy immigration law, you lose federal funding — period.

No more taxpayer dollars for lawlessness. https://t.co/0pNRejKPcR

Rescinding USAID funds now is a commonsense way to ensure it doesn’t become a slush fund for bureaucrats or international NGOs with no accountability to the American people.

READ MORE from my Op-Ed published today by the @dcexaminer:

https://t.co/bPmqeJ5DpA

📌 TODAY: In response to growing threats from violent cartels, terrorist networks, and lawless sanctuary cities, Congresswoman Sheri Biggs (R-SC-03) has introduced two national security bills to stop the flow of fentanyl, restore immigration enforcement, and protect American communities.

“Americans are watching sanctuary cities spiral out of control, while cartel-backed traffickers smuggle poison into our neighborhoods,” said Congresswoman Biggs. “These bills deliver real consequences to those who aid our enemies and defy our laws.”

🔈  No Passports for Terrorists and Traffickers Act 

🔈  Mobilizing Against Sanctuary Cities Act 

https://t.co/BBBnUx2n9h

The lawlessness we’ve seen in Los Angeles over the weekend as criminals set parts of the city on fire and damage personal property because ICE is doing their job to keep our nation safe is disgusting and should not be tolerated.

I will drop legislation tomorrow that will give extra tools to help rid our streets of these terrorists…not empower them. Stay tuned! 🚨

Today, we remember the heroes of D-Day — those brave Americans who stormed the beaches of Normandy 81 years ago to defend freedom and defeat tyranny.

Their courage changed the course of history. We honor their sacrifice, and we will never forget. 🇺🇸 https://t.co/50KnNPDd0b

🚨 A 24% tax hike is looming — and South Carolina families, small businesses, and workers could pay the price.

I voted for the One Big Beautiful Bill Act which stops the largest tax increase in American history and protects South Carolina’s Third District from Washington’s reckless spending spree.

I’m fighting for YOU.

There are few better examples of what it means to serve in, and out, of the uniform than Mr. Jesse Taylor. A Vietnam veteran, having served in the Army for 14 years, Mr. Taylor founded Vets Helping Vets which as it’s name implies gives back to our veterans in a multitude of ways to help make their life outside of service to our nation better. And I’m pleased to call him my friend. 

This week, I joined my many friends at Vets Helping Vets in presenting a flag and a posting of the official Congressional Record recognizing Jesse for his service to our great nation and to his fellow veterans in the Upstate. 

God bless our veterans!
God bless Corporal Lucas Watts and all the brave men and women in law enforcement who keep our communities safe!

For 101 years, the U.S. Border Patrol has protected our homeland. As a member of the Homeland Security Committee, I’m working every day to support our agents and strengthen America’s border security. https://t.co/P3xBckaBqL

I've said it before, energy security is national security. It was a pleasure to join @PalmettoPromise other industry leaders to for a roundtable discussion on the impacts our energy policy has on security, innovation, and our workforce.

I was very honored and humbled to be with a large crowd of our veterans and families to show respect to our fallen heroes at the Richard Michael Campbell Veterans Nursing home.

As I told a local reporter at the ceremony, I hope individuals continue that message ["freedom isn't free"] and teach their young children that there are people who have made sacrifices for them. 🇺🇸

https://t.co/eYDymUo8BD

On Memorial Day, we remember those who paid the ultimate price — and we honor them by caring for those who made it home.

That’s why I introduced the Veterans Life Insurance Expansion & Integrity Act — a no-cost solution to ensure every veteran under 81 can access the VA life insurance they deserve.

Because service doesn’t end with the uniform. Neither should our support. 🇺🇸

Read my full release here: https://t.co/mo1RfF0euN

Freedom is never free. On this Memorial Day, we remember the heroes who paid the ultimate price for our liberty. May we live in a way that honors their sacrifice — with strength, service, and unity.

I also want to thank all the veterans in South Carolina’s 3rd District. Your courage, service, and continued presence in our communities are deeply appreciated. 🇺🇸

Yesterday was a lovely day to be at the Haven of Rest Ministries Golf Classic. ⛳️

Haven of Rest is one of the many wonderful, Christ-centered organizations that provides hope, healing, and recovery for those in need in our communities. https://t.co/0d7cUHW13A

Happy 237th Birthday to the great state of South Carolina! 🇺🇸 From our rich history to our bright future, there’s no place like the Palmetto State. Proud to call it home and honored to serve its incredible people. https://t.co/hczTVHiwys

My statement on the passage of the One Big Beautiful Bill — proud to stand with President Trump and deliver results for South Carolina’s Third District. 🇺🇸

Click here to read my full press release:
https://t.co/rcMUVDR4Hb https://t.co/IyeVskbsHw

It’s always an honor to preside over the House floor and help lead the proceedings of the People’s House. I’m proud to represent South Carolina’s Third District and serve with purpose. 🇺🇸 https://t.co/TGey9B5n7q

Recently, I spoke at a Homeland Security Committee hearing with DHS Secretary Noem.

I asked her directly: What tools do you need to get the job done and secure our border? Turns out the biggest need was new leadership in the White House.

Under President Trump’s leadership, illegal border crossings have decreased 95%. The safety of our communities depends on a safe, closed border. I will continue to work with the Administration, and through my role on the Homeland Security Committee, to keep our nation safe and secure! 🇺🇸

This National EMS Week, we honor the brave men and women who serve on the front lines of emergency care. As a former ICU nurse, I know firsthand the dedication, courage, and skill it takes to answer the call. Thank you for protecting our communities — you are true heroes. 🇺🇸🚑 #EMSWeek #ThankYouEMS

As a proud member of the Air National Guard, I’m honored to stand alongside the brave men and women who serve our nation with strength and sacrifice. That’s why I introduced the FIGHTER Act — to eliminate federal income taxes on active duty pay. On this #ArmedForcesDay, we salute all who wear the uniform and defend our freedom. 🇺🇸

Honored to join Speaker Johnson and my House colleagues in prayer at the Capitol to remember and honor our fallen law enforcement officers. Grateful to stand alongside heroes from South Carolina who put their lives on the line every day. We will never forget their sacrifice. 🖤💙🇺🇸 #BackTheBlue

I had the honor of taking to the House floor to recognize Deputy Watts — South Carolina Sheriff’s Association’s Deputy of the Year and a true hero from our district. His perseverance, faith, and love for family and community remind us what service and sacrifice truly mean. God bless those who wear the badge. 🇺🇸🖤💙

This #PoliceWeek, we honor the brave men and women who wear the badge and keep our communities safe. With law enforcement in my own family, this week holds special meaning. I always enjoy when I can meet with officers from across South Carolina to thank them for their service and stand with them in support. 🇺🇸👮‍♂️👮‍♀️ #BackTheBlue

Congratulations to the graduates of @ErskineCollege. It was an honor to join with you today and provide the commencement address. 

And for all those graduating in the Class of 2025 across South Carolina, I challenge you too: “Go forward boldly. Build strong families, strong communities, and do your part to help build an even stronger nation.”

I invited you to SUBSCRIBE to my e-newsletter by visiting https://t.co/5cVS03i3tA.

In each "Biggs Bulletin," I share updates from what's going on in Washington and all around South Carolina's Third District.

Stay in touch - you won't want to miss it! 🇺🇸 https://t.co/wioT8mofKv

Today my sweet Momma celebrates her birthday. 🎉 Thank you, Mom, for being such a strong, faithful role model, and showing me by example what is means to be a Proverbs 31 woman.

To my mom, and all the mothers out there, Happy Mother’s Day weekend! Being “Mom” to two wonderful children is the greatest honor and I’m so grateful. 💐

Honored to present this year’s Congressional Art Competition winner! 🎨🇺🇸 The talent and creativity of our students in South Carolina’s Third District never cease to amaze me. Congratulations to Mackenzie Evans of Wren High School (@OfficialWren)  — your artwork will proudly hang in halls of the U.S. Capitol!

This week, I pushed for updates on the future of quantum technology — an exciting field that could impact everything from national security to our economy. I asked how we can better train American workers and bring key manufacturing back home, because I know South Carolina’s Third District is ready to lead! 🇺🇸

Today, on Military Spouse Appreciation
Day, I want to say a heartfelt thank you to the
incredible spouses who stand beside our service
members. Their strength, sacrifice, and quiet courage
often go unseen — but never unappreciated.

loyalty you give so selflessly. We see you. We honor
you. And we’re grateful beyond words. 🇺🇸💙

I’m thankful to President Trump, @POTUS, for inviting me to the Oval Office recently for a special event and recognition of conservative women leaders that took place in the White House.

I brought the voices of South Carolina’s Upstate straight to Washington.

During a Homeland Security hearing, I pressed federal officials on how we can cut red tape, improve coordination, and use better tools — like drone technology — to help communities recover faster after disasters like the Table Rock and Persimmon Ridge fires.

Our families and first responders demand action, not bureaucracy.

In the wake of the Table Rock and Persimmon Ridge fires, families and small businesses need help — not more red tape.

That’s why I voted for the “Filing Relief for Natural Disasters Act” and the “Disaster Related Extension of Deadlines Act” — two bills that give impacted communities more time to complete filings and meet critical deadlines after disasters.

These commonsense reforms will make it easier for folks to recover, rebuild, and move forward.

Our service members have defended freedom at home and abroad. They have fought for us, and it is past time we fight for them. The FIGHTER Act - which I will introduce in Congress next week - is a small but powerful way to say, “We see you. We appreciate you. And we’re going to fight for you because you bravely fight for us.”

This is more than a tax policy — it is a promise that in a time of growing global threats, America will always stand with — and fight for — her warriors.

https://t.co/JR0QSFy4ar

This afternoon, I got an aerial assessment of the fires in Pickens and Greenville counties with @RepTimmons and state officials, and spent more time on the ground with the command team.

While thankfully so far there have been no fatalities and no residential loss, the fires are still in a very dangerous state. I’m thankful to Governor @henrymcmaster for his visit to the district today and for his team’s efforts in helping with the efforts.

While progress is being made, there’s still a lot of work still to be done - and a change in weather could be very helpful.

Pray for rain!

This afternoon I visited with the rescue and operations teams at Table Rock fire command center. What I experienced was hundreds of emergency personnel, fire & rescue, staff support, and volunteers - not just from the Upstate, but from all over the state - working diligently with one clear focus in mind: containment and keeping our people safe. 

I’m so grateful for their efforts and for our neighbors in the community who have stepped up and provided extra hands and supplies to support their efforts. 

Tomorrow Governor McMaster will visit Table Rock and provide an on-the-ground update and media briefing around 11:15 a.m.
Honored to be in the White House with @POTUS, @SpeakerJohnson, and this group of incredible women of the @HouseGOP!

I have continued to be in touch with officials in Pickens and Greenville Counties, and we're following the fire-fighting efforts closely.

I've been inspired to see how the community has stepped up to help each other. 🙏
